The COMPETES Act will reduce costs for NJ families & help our businesses better compete with China. While I do not agree with everything the bill includes, I believe on the whole it will have a positive impact. And I intend to continue working to improve the bill moving forward.

My methane mitigation amendment creates a grant program for states like NJ to offset energy costs for families. It also provides incentives for companies to accelerate and expand improvements to their natural gas distribution systems so we can reduce pollution in our communities.

NIST promotes innovation and competitiveness by advancing measurement science, standards, and tech in ways that enhance economic security. My amendment will strengthen their ability to develop and manage greenhouse gas emissions measurements, which will boost our competitiveness.

And, with that in mind, my amendment investing in long-duration energy storage technology will help us develop new and better ways to increase grid resiliency and reliability so we have less of the power outages North Jersey has come to expect.

NJ needs clean reliable electricity. To this end, I included a provision in this bill that would fund research for rooftop solar & reliable grid tech. We need to support energy innovation at home, not buy from China, to give Americans the affordable, renewable energy of tomorrow.

I was proud to work with @RepTimRyan and @NormaJTorres to ensure the bill creates an expert commission to address supply chain disruptions and establish a supply chain database for our manufacturing sector. These will help us to reduce supply chain problems and prices in NJ.

To combat inflation, I also authored an amendment to help critical supply chain sectors like the trucking and warehouse industries hire and train more workers quickly, by expanding access to our national apprenticeship system.

A top concern that I hear about in NJ-11 is rising prices and inflation. Because of this, I made sure the bill included an amendment requiring the Comptroller General to study and report on how this bill will help to reduce inflation and ensure that funds are spent responsibly.

To that end, after discussing these issues with my constituents, I secured inclusion of several amendments to improve this bill. These amendments focus on some of the most important issues to North Jersey families - cost of living and inflation, renewable energy, and jobs.

This bill is a strong step in the right direction. Moving forward, I remain committed to working to ensure the final version of this legislation does everything possible to lower costs for NJ families.

On Friday, I was proud to vote for the America COMPETES Act, which will help strengthen our supply chain and reduce inflation, increase our competitiveness with China, and bolster R&D initiatives that are critical to innovation and GDP growth.
